Dr. Md. Anwar Ullah, FCMA (born 1964) is a Bangladeshi civil servant and academic who served as Secretary of the Bangladesh Parliament Secretariat from September to December 2024. He is a member of the Bangladesh Civil Service (Administration) cadre, joining in 1991, and has held various senior positions in the Government of Bangladesh.
Early life and education
Ullah was born in Cumilla District, Bangladesh. He completed his Secondary School Certificate (SSC) examination in 1980, ranking 19th in the merit list under the Cumilla Education Board, and his Higher Secondary Certificate (HSC) in 1982, ranking 8th.
He obtained his Bachelor of Commerce (Honours) degree in Accounting from the University of Dhaka in 1985, securing 8th position in his class, followed by a Master of Commerce degree in 1986, ranking 6th. He received merit scholarships from both the Government of Bangladesh and the University of Dhaka during his undergraduate and postgraduate studies.
Ullah pursued further education abroad, earning a Post Graduate Diploma in Managerial Control and Management Information Systems from the Maastricht School of Management in the Netherlands in 1999, supported by a Royal Netherlands Government Fellowship. He completed an MBA in Corporate Strategy and Economic Policy from the same institution in 2001 with 78% marks, funded by a Bangladesh Government Scholarship.
In 2011, he received his PhD in Regional and Rural Development Planning from the Asian Institute of Technology in Thailand, with a dissertation titled "Mobilisation of Local Resources for Local Development in Bangladesh." His doctoral studies were supported by a Bangladesh Government Scholarship under the Japan Debt Cancellation Fund and an AIT Fellowship.
He is a Fellow Chartered Management Accountant (FCMA) of the Institute of Cost and Management Accountants of Bangladesh (ICMAB), obtaining this professional qualification in 2004.
Career
Civil service
Ullah joined the Bangladesh Civil Service (Administration) cadre in 1991. His career began as an Assistant Secretary at the Ministry of Finance in 1991, followed by positions as Assistant Commissioner and Magistrate in various districts including Naogaon (1992-1993) and Chattogram (1998-1999).
From 1994 to 1997, he served as Assistant Commissioner (Land) in Nababganj, Dhaka and Patiya, Chattogram, handling land administration and property records. He worked in the Budget Wing of the Finance Division from 2001 to 2002, contributing to national budget formulation.
Ullah held several positions related to disability rights and social welfare. He served as Director at the Jatiyo Protibondhi Unnayan Foundation (JPUF) under the Ministry of Social Welfare from 2012 to 2016, where he was involved in implementing a World Bank project on disability. From January 2020 to August 2022, he served as Managing Director of the Neuro-Development Disability Protection Trust, focusing on strategic action plans for persons with neuro-developmental disabilities and compliance with the Disability Rights and Protection Act, 2013.
In the labour sector, he worked as Additional Inspector General at the Department of Factories and Establishments (2017-2018) and Additional Director General at the Department of Labor (2019), overseeing factory safety compliance and workers' rights.
He was appointed Joint Secretary in the Statistics and Information Division, Ministry of Planning, on 1 September 2022, where he was responsible for statistics laws, population census, and research programs. On 24 August 2024, he was promoted to Additional Secretary in the Ministry of Public Administration.
On 15 September 2024, Ullah was promoted to the rank of Secretary and posted to the Bangladesh Parliament Secretariat. As Secretary, he served as the chief executive and principal accounting officer of the Secretariat, overseeing seven wings and managing approximately 1,400 regular employees and 600 security personnel. His tenure concluded on 31 December 2024.
Academic career
Alongside his civil service career, Ullah has served as an adjunct faculty member at several universities in Bangladesh. Since 2012, he has taught MBA courses at Southeast University Bangladesh. He has also been an adjunct faculty at the Institute of Cost and Management Accountants of Bangladesh (ICMAB) since 2005, delivering lectures on cost and management accounting.
He previously taught at Independent University, Bangladesh (2012), ASA University Bangladesh (2011-2013), and State University Bangladesh (2011-2012). He has also served as a guest speaker at various government training institutions including the Bangladesh Public Administration Training Centre, Bangladesh Civil Service Administrative Training Academy, and Bangladesh Planning and Development Academy.
Research and publications
Ullah's research interests include educational quality assurance, quality of life, disability and civil rights, assistive technology, and SME financial management.
He has published extensively on topics including local government finance, autism screening technology, disability rights, and industrial safety. Notable publications include research on augmented reality interventions for children with autism spectrum disorder, published in Computers journal (2023), and several articles on local resource mobilization and rural governance published in the Asian Social Science journal.
He has been involved in developing technology-based autism screening tools, including "Smart Autism Barta" and "Autism Express," presenting this work at international conferences including the IEEE Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society Conference (2016) and IEEE TENCON (2016).
Ullah serves as an associate editor for the journal The Cost and Management, published by ICMAB.
Awards and recognition
In 2023, Ullah received the National Integrity Award from the Government of Bangladesh. In 2024, he received the Best Entrepreneurship Award (1st Place) as team leader for an innovative project titled "Personal Information Management System (PIMS)" at the Innovation Showcasing 2024 organized by the Ministry of Planning.
Professional memberships
Ullah is a member of several professional organizations including:
* Chairman, Governing Body of Bangladesh Institute of Administration and Management (BIAM) Foundation
* Member, Institute of Cost and Management Accountants of Bangladesh (ICMAB)
* AIT Alumni, Asian Institute of Technology
* Life Member, Dhaka University Registered Graduate
* Member, Bangladesh Administrative Service Association (BASA)
